courses.subject: SEMS
courses.courseTitle: INTRODUCTION TO STEM TEACHING I: INQUIRY APPROACHES TO TEACHING
courses.description: A first exploration into teaching as a career, emphasizing inquiry-based science and constructivist mathematics. Field experience with upper elementary grades includes two classroom observations and three teaching experiences.

courses.subject: SEMS
courses.courseTitle: INTRODUCTION TO STEM TEACHING II: INQUIRY-BASED LESSON DESIGN
courses.description: A second exploration into teaching as a career, focusing on the development of STEM lesson plans aligned to district curricula, attributes of adolescent students, utilization of technology, questioning strategies, and formal and informal methods of assessment.

courses.subject: SEMS
courses.courseTitle: INTRODUCTION TO STEM TEACHING I & II COMBINED
courses.description: A combined exploration into teaching as a career, emphasizing inquiry-based science and constructivist mathematics, and development of STEM lesson plans aligned to district curricula. Includes middle school field experience in either mathematics or science.

courses.subject: SEMS
courses.description: For prospective mathematics and science teachers to construct the model of knowing and learning that they will take with them into their classrooms. Focuses on issues of what it means to know and learn science and mathematics.

courses.subject: SEMS
courses.description: Centered around a close examination of the interplay between teachers, students, and content, and how such interactions enable students to develop deep conceptual understanding. Focus is given to building awareness and understanding of equity issues.

courses.subject: SEMS
courses.description: Explores a selection of topics and episodes in the history of science and mathematics, illustrating how knowledge emerges through struggles and social contexts.

courses.subject: SEMS
courses.courseTitle: DIVERSITY AND DIFFERENCE IN THE STEM CLASSROOM
courses.description: Examines what it means to be a diverse learner and prepares teachers to respond to diverse student needs, focusing on STEM education and specialized pedagogy required in those disciplines.

courses.subject: SEMS
courses.description: A theory-driven course on project-based instruction in STEM. Includes developing a project-based unit, field experience in local schools, and teaching well-implemented project-based instruction.

courses.subject: SEMS
courses.description: Seminar for full-time student interns to discuss classroom experiences and current teaching issues. Graded S/U.

courses.subject: SEMS
courses.description: Special topics in STEM education. Content varies and may be repeated once for a total of 6 units.

courses.subject: SEMS
courses.description: An opportunity for especially qualified students to undertake research problems or study projects relevant to their interest and training under the direction of a staff member.

courses.subject: SEMS
courses.courseTitle: INTERNSHIP IN MATHEMATICS AND SCIENCE SECONDARY EDUCATION
courses.description: Clinical experience in secondary education with a focus on classroom management, technology utilization, and reflective practices.
